item.title: Counting Strings - Part 1
item.description: One day, I was solving a recurrence problem from Kenneth Rosen’s Discrete Math book. Question 1 Find the recurrence for the number of bitstrings of length n, containing no two consecutive zeros This is quite easy, right? Let \(a_n\) be the number of strings of length n. If the string starts with \(1\), we have \(a_{n-1}\) choices since there’s no restriction. If the string starts with \(0\), we must have \(0\) after it, so \(a_{n-2}\) choices.
